description:
Date: 26/05/2020

Positives: 
- Excellent concept, and even better execution. 
- More customisable than a regular eOS app.

Negatives: 
- Forces eOS specific GUI - looks outright ugly on gnome. 
- You can't specify notes directory. 
- The data is not accessible outside the app.

I will be coming back to it in a few months. It's definitely one of the best note-taking apps, if you can bear eOS being shoved down your gullet (reminds me of another brand many linux users are trying to get away from...).
Very nice software
i'd like to sync my tasks with Nextcloud, so please add more sync setttings

Annoying shortcuts and conflict with other apps (example ctrl+tab in chrome).
text color problem, white in light theme and dark in the dark theme!!
I Never suggest it to anyone

Errors that killed my data were fixed, but didn't bring back my data.
User data backup/restore needed.
I'd like to use the software, but I don't know how often I have yet to lose all my data. 
See error #454, #434, and others.
summary: Can't use as long as data keeps getting lost

description: pretty nice application, integrates well with Elemetery, but can be improved by making it more compatable with Gnome.
summary: Cool Application, can be better if ported to Gnome

description: so use full and light

First I am with GNOME and Fedora 32 and some buttons, titles, etc. are not showing! No matter which theme I choose, it is just not working.

Then the app is poor for those who are planning a project with overlapping events and need of timetables. If you are looking for this, just forget it.

Not for me. Uninstalling now...

The idea behind this program is good. However, there are some obvious features missing, such as changing the status of a project from local to synced with todoist. The only way to make a project being synced with todoist is to mark it as synced with todoist when you first create the project, but the default seem to be making a local project, so it is really easy making a local project by mistake and the not later being able to sync it with todoist. This is an obvious flaw and needs to be corrected.

Liking it very much so far except some fields have the test color the same as the background color. All "themes" have the same bug - you can't see text in a field unless you click / highlight that field.
summary: Great so far except for critical bug

description: this is the best Productivity App i have ever used

Hard can it be to manage a task list? Running ToDoist in a browser tab appears to use minimal additional resources. Running Planner takes 15-20% CPU on my i7-8650! Nope, not worth it, uninstalling and going back to the web version!
Awesome UX/UI and lovely features. Thank you so much.

The app works fine, but I am desperately looking for an app that allows for template tasks or duplication of existing tasks. On the apps website, it says that version 2.4 can do that, on the fedora Software app, it says that the available version is 2.4.6, but when clicking on install, the 2.3.5 version is installed.

Awesome interface, plenty of features, sync with Todoist, due dates, tags, categorization of projects into folders, dark mode... It has everything.
I use it everyday for work, and to run my youtube channel, and it hasn't failed me.
summary: The best task / project management app

I wanted to ununstall after I installed. Neither Discover (where it was installed from) nor dnf can remove it.

description: The app works perfectly, I love the interface, it's clean and simple. You can sync with todoist, but I wish there were more syncing options like dropbox or pcloud.
Beautiful.Elegant.Rich Feature's.

I don't like the app because you can only save your content locally or you have to use the paid subscription service Todoist. I would like to see a way for this app's data to sync with an online data storage site like MEGA or Dropbox.
probably the best "get things done" application on linux

description: I do like it a lot, it does look like it belongs on a GTK-based destktop, either on Elementary, GNOME or MATE. And it helps neuroatypicals work faster and easier.
summary: One of the best note-taking apps for linux!

description: This a the Best app that helps me manage my task
I like it! , Keep good work!

When you click on a task, the font color changes to white. Since the background is also white, this makes the task un-readable. 

After clicking around for a while, I discovered that there are tags in the left-side pane. They are also written in white on a white background, so I easily could have missed then. 

Really a shame, this app could have been nice, but this issue makes it impossible to use
Very nice and easy to use to-do app!

Overall the app seems like a really awesome app to use. However, after creating a task the text for a title task turn the same color as the background color making the text invisible unless I highlight the text. This makes it nearly impossible to use the application. It's a real shame because images of what the app is supposed to look like, look real nice. I was looking forward to use this app. I tried switching the application color theme but the same issue continued. I hope this gets fixed soon.

I am running Fedora 33.
summary: Text Turns Same Color as Background

I know the text is there because if you select it yo can see it but as soon as you un select the text it becomes invisible (text and background have the same color). There are some other erratic behavior in the app, it does just not feel right.
App works great on KDE Neon, but after I enabled sync with todoist.com I lost all my notes in planner and there were no notes synced to my todoist.com account

description: I started using it, its intuitive and gets the job done.
None of the color schemes are legible when Fedora is in dark mode.
This is a fantastic app for staying organized. Use the Flatpak version if you run into issues with theming in Fedora.
I like the application, but it needs more effort to become free of bugs and crashes.

- Lost all data without me doing anything after an automatic update
- No backup of any kinda to recover data
- Original database has been overwritten has an empty database
- History of data-losses (check its github issue tracker)
- Do not use it if you want to keep track of serious things
summary: Do not use it for serious things

description: Minimal and Elegant UI, Extensive Functionality
There are few to-do apps available for Linux, however Planner is my go to choice. It has a great and elegant UI.

Be careful when you upgrade from 2.7 to 3.0. Data export failed and the database got overwritten.

The upgrade process hasn't been handled properly. This has already been reported on GitHub, but the developer hasn't issued any warnings or even made a noticeable effort to respond to the reported issue.
summary: Decent application, but upgrade to 3.0 lost all data

description: I can not import the tasks from version 2.x to version 3.0. That is just awful.

Bad enough that my data from v2 got wiped during the upgrade, but I can't create any new tasks, projects, labels, anything. On Ubuntu 18.04.6, GNOME Shell 3.28.4

Used to be a good product though, and I'll change my review if it works again.

I loved this at first. Great colours, easy user interface. Until it updated, now looks completely different, and everything that was written (all my tasks, etc.) is just a series of random numbers. I've lost everything. I'll think I'll go back to hard-copies from now on.
summary: Was great until it deleted everything after auto-updating

description: This app looks horrible anywhere else except Elementary OS. I'm not going to install a specific distribution to use an app, build it for GNOME, not some niche distro.
summary: App is built for elementary so it looks bad on other distros

description:
Since the upgrade to ver 3, I lost all my scheduling data and the app no longer works......nothing, absolutely nothing works. I'll try it again maybe when these recent bugs are fixed, until then I need to find something else.
JW (linux user since 1995)
It's a solid app. I would keep using it if it wasn't tagged as 'unsafe' in Software due to the fact that it can access your file system and uses insecure dependencies. Otherwise, very nice app.
It can sync with todoist, but the labels do not show visible.

It is an amazing app I've ever used, really helped with my productivity.
Highly recommended.
It works amazing, no complains

Fedora 36, GNOME. The tool doesn't work in my environment. The colors are completely wrong, for example: white text on white background, in dark mode - black text on black bachground. Buttons or other UI elements dissapeares. Unable to work with it.

Here on Fedora 35, version 3.0.7 shows completely off colors, which make it very hard to read and hence use the app

By far the best app for project management on linux. I didn't expect that level of design and functionnality. I'm so grateful ^^

Please fix the themeing issue. I am on Fedora 36 and both dark and light mode has limted text visibility. check screenshots

Not able to do anything on ubuntu after update - lost all data too
Sadly I cannot use this app as the "Settings" window closes whenever the app loses focus. That means you cannot copy+paste credentials from your password manager.
I was surprised when downloaded, it is a very good app, good interface I like the organization that propose it.
It is so hard to click I do not like it, and the font is too small

I used planner for two months, and I was very happy. Suddenly, after a routine update, all my tasks and projects are exported to a JSON file, and I have to migrate them manually to use the new version. Honestly I'm very disappointed... I don't know if I should make the effort to migrate dozens of projects and items to the new version. Can I trust that newer versions will not break again?
Einfach zu bedienen und hat alle Features welche ich brauche!

Grundsätzlich ist die Idee der Anwendung sehr nett.
Ich verwende sie allerdings aus folgenden Gründen nicht:
1. Die Benutzung wird durch kaputtes Font-Rendering (Setup: Arch Linux, 4K/UHD-Bildschirm, zumindest auf wayland) leider deutlich getrübt.
Leider gibt es wohl auch keine regulären, nativen Pakete (In Arch Linux/AUR) sondern wohl nur diese Hipster-Builds, die wie beschrieben kaputt sind.
Es ist einfach schade, weil man sieht wieviel Herzblut und Aufwand in die Entwicklung der genialen Applikation geflossen sind und es dann an solchen Kleinigkeiten bröselt.
2. Was mir auch etwas fehlt ist zumindest rudimentäre Übertragung von Tasks mit caldav.
Ich verstehe einfach nicht wie in Gnome immer irgendwelche Anbindungen für kommerzielle Dienstleister implementiert werden (bspw. Gnome Online Accounts mit den Top-Evil-Corps) und die offensichtlichen Lösungen wie die offenen Industriestandards CalDAV/CardDAV oder FLOSS-Alternativen wie Nextcloud/Owncloud/Seafile/Sparkleshare/Syncthing/Baikal/SabreDav, ... allenfalls stiefmütterlich oder gar nicht unterstützt werden. Das ist sehr schade.
Hier muss man der Fairness wegen sagen, dass wohl immerhin für Kalender-Events eine Anbindung in Evolution implementiert und damit CalDAV-Unterstützung gegeben ist.
summary: Gute Idee, Umsetzung nicht ganz perfekt

description: Wirklich die beste To-do Liste, vorallem weil man sie durch Todoist auf jedem seiner Geräte haben kann.

Die App ist genau das, wonach ich gesucht habe, leider ist sie komplett verbuggt und einige Dinge sind auch nicht wirklich nutzerfreundlich oder logisch.

Ein Beispiel für einen Bug ist, dass der Text beim editieren von Eintragen, der Name dieser vollständig durchsichtig wird.

Ein Beispiel für etwas unlogisches/nicht nutzerfreundliches ist, dass man einen Task, den man als wiederholend eingestellt hat, abhaken kann was keinen wirklichen Sinn ergibt und in den allermeisten fällen ungewollt ist, da die Löschen Option hier vollkommen ausreichen sollte und es einfach ist einen wiederholenden Task versehentlich abzuhaken.
Das was ich vom GUI sehen kann ist etwas seltsam, aber ich kann ja nicht viel sehen da das Program Weiss auf Weiss darstellt unter Gnome. Schade
Es wäre gut, wenn es nicht so viele Bugs geben würde. Aufgaben werden nicht gespeichert, verschwinden beim Ziehen, etc.
Excelente programa para organizar tu trabajo

1. BONITO
2. No maneja el concepto de recurso
3. Sin diagramas de Gant
4. Sin carga de trabajo
5. ¿Llamarse Planner habiendo otro Planner de gestión de proyectos?... pensando bien, es de cutres; pensando mal, ya dilo tú.
summary: Muy bonito pero un poco cutre que se llame Planner, como el de Gnome

description: Me parece la mejor aplicación de tareas de linux, es como todo list pero open source y offline, lo único "malo" es que no funciona bien en entornos con xorg, pero en gnome, sway o kde funciona de maravilla, nunca olvidaré lo que debo hacer gracias a esta app.
summary: La mejor aplicación de tareas en linux

description: El diseño me parece bueno, solo que al escribir el nombre de la tarea este se pinta de color blanco cuando inicialmente estaba en negro
summary: Color del nombre de la tarea en blanco

description: Muy buena aplicación, uno de los mejores gestores de tareas de Linux
summary: Muy buena aplicación, uno de los mejores gestores de tareas de Linux

description: Une inquiétude, si je ne veux pas utiliser la connexion à todoist pour garder mes données, il n'y a pas d'export pour le jour où je changerai d'ordinateur.

J'aime beaucoup Planner que j'utilise depuis maintenant presque 2 ans et il semblerait que la dernière version apporte beaucoup d'éléments très attendus. Malheureusement, elle semble peu stable, du moins sur Ubuntu 22.04. En effet, chaque fois que je clique sur certaines touches, il plante simplement. Par ailleurs, avec cette nouvelle mise à jour, toutes mes données ont été effacées et il semblerait qu'il soit impossible d'importer une sauvegarde faite avec la version précédente dans celle-ci. Du coup, je dois tout recommencer, ce qui est assez ennuyeux.
summary: Planner 3 bêta 2 pas très stable et divers bugs

description: похож на модный things для macos
Приложение красивое и удобное, но жаль нет синхронизации с Nextcloud. Todoist желания нет начинать использовать для синхронизации.
Красивое, приятное и удобное приложение для ведения заметок

I'm using Fedora 32 with Gnome 3.36.6 and not happy with the UI here. When I click onto the created task the title becomes white on white background.
None of the other themes but the default one is usable because the font color is at a very low contrast and barely readable. Please, fix that.
summary: UI has bugs, unable to use

description: Искал себе удобные заметки для Linux. Пошёл гуглить, наткнулся на это приложение. Выглядит стильно, весьма удобное. Порадовала возможность синхронизации с Todoist. Единственное, имеется неприятный баг. Есть возможность быстрого добавления заметкой по нажатию Super+N. Удобно, но при переключении раскладки окно пропадает. Надеюсь, разработчики поправят этот косяк (Я такой не один, подобное Issue есть на Github). Однозначно 5!

При перетягивании задач или разделов внутри проекта запросто отваливается (скрывается до перезагрузки приложения) целый раздел, так что составлять планы не так удобно.

Напоминает и Things, и Todoist, и со вторым можно настроить синхронизацию, хотя искал только локальное решение. На фоне других доступных приложений подобного плана это понравилось чуть больше.
Просто, быстро, удобно. На фоне аналогов - пока не перегружено лишними свистелками.
на xubunte при запуске встало на начальном окне с предложением импорта и не реагирует ни на что больше
